question: Can I refinance my home loan if my current interest rate is 5% and my credit score improved to 720?
true_answer: Yes, refinancing is possible with improved credit score of 720 and current rate of 5%.

steps.content: Can I refinance my home loan if my current interest rate is 5% and my credit score improved to 720?
Plan: 1) Transfer to home_loan_agent for refinance criteria. 2) Validate new credit score with credit_agent. 3) Use calculator for interest savings. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Refinancing typically benefits when credit score improves and existing rate is high.
Validating credit score: 720 is considered good and can qualify for better rates.
What could be the new interest rate I might get?
Retrieving current interest rates for good credit scores.
Current rates for scores above 700 range around 3.5% to 4%.
Refinancing from 5% to 3.5% could save significant interest over loan term.
Review complete, refinancing beneficial with improved score.
Yes, refinancing is possible with improved credit score of 720 and current rate of 5%. Potential new rate could be around 3.5%.
